newsitem.title: UK: IPE Brent softer on physical market, despite APIs.
newsitem.headline: IPE Brent softer on physical market, despite APIs.

text.p: IPE Brent crude oil futures were weaker on Wednesday as the North Sea physical market fell back, despite the release of mildly bullish overnight inventory data from the U.S., traders and brokers said.
September Brent was 12 cents a barrel weaker at $19.40 a barrel at 0938 GMT while August gas oil was 25 cents a tonne up at $176.50, below pre-opening market expectations.
"There is some spread selling - the September/October has widened out to -9 cents - this is because of the easier cash markets," a broker said.
